missionProperties.repositionOverride: Block access to the security stations.

events.eventText:
You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

After successfully sneaking aboard the Chimaera using stolen docking codes, you move cautiously through the corridors of the massive Star Destroyer. At the door to the infiltrator droid processing center, a Death Trooper guard steps in your path. “Access codes?” Your hesitation is unacceptable, and the trooper levels his rifle. {-} Deploy the heroes to the blue highlighted space. {-} Doors are locked.

eventActions.tbText: Multiple security stations control the door locks.

translatedEntityProperties.theText:
The security station that locks the doors is shielded by heavy plating.

{-} A figure can attack a security station (Health: 2 plus *1*; Defense: 1 {G}).

The security station that locks the doors is shielded by heavy plating.

{-} A figure can attack a security station (Health: 2 plus *1*; Defense: 1 {G}).

The security station that locks the doors is shielded by heavy plating.

{-} A figure can attack a security station (Health: 2 plus *1*; Defense: 1 {G}).

eventActions.tbText:
{-} Imperial mission tokens represent security stations. A figure can attack a security station (Health: 2 plus *1*; Defense: 1 {G}).
{-} When all 3 security stations are destroyed, the doors unlock.

eventActions.theText:
{-} Doors are locked.
{-} Imperial mission tokens represent security stations. A figure can attack a security station (Health: 2 plus *1*; Defense: 1 {G}).
{-} When all 3 security stations are destroyed, the doors unlock.
{-} The mission will progress when a door opens.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

events.eventText:
You sprint away, leaving smoldering wreckage and a stunned Thrawn behind. You transmit the coordinates of the nearest airlock to your pilot and escape the wrath of the Empire.

{-} The Rebels win the mission!
{-} Heroes receive 100 credits per hero.

eventActions.mainText: Are you playing this mission as part of the "Tyrants of Lothal" mini campaign?

events.eventText:
Thrawns troops circle you and begin to close in. You throw an entire satchel of smoke grenades at their feet and run choking to your waiting shuttle.

{-} The Rebels lose the mission.
{-} If playing this mission as a side mission, the Empire receives <color="red">Thrawn</color> (Grand Admiral) as a villain.

eventActions.mainText: Are you playing this mission as part of the "Tyrants of Lothal" mini campaign?

events.eventText:
Upon arriving on your ship, you head for hyperspace, pursued by TIE fighters. The shuttle shakes under the Chimaera's fire one more time, then you jump to safety.

"Even Thrawn can't just put that away. I'm sure he's made backups somewhere, but it's still going to take a long time to restore the data," Sabine says. "I wish I could have been there. I'm sure an exploding mainframe like that makes for some pretty fireworks."

"Get some rest for a few days," Hera suggests. "I'm sure Thrawn will have a manhunt out for you. Besides, you've earned it."

{-} Each hero receives 1 XP.
{-} Heroes receive 100 credits per hero.

eventActions.tbText:
You hear the heated debate in the Ghost's common room well before you see it. "This could be our best chance to take the fight to Thrawn", insists Ezra, gesturing toward a holographic depiction of Lothal, complete with several Star Destroyers in orbit. "I know this might be a trap, but what if it isn't? We've been working hard to find an opening to strike back at Thrawn."

You interrupt to ask what's going on.

"An Imperial engineer got us a message", says Kanan. "He wants to defect, and he says he can get us into the datavault containing everything Thrawn's infiltrator droids have gathered." You have to simply imagine the significant look on Kanan's face as the mask tilts in your direction. "Information that gives him an edge on the Rebellion. But someone just letting us in? It sounds too good to be true."

"We'd never even get to the ground with Thrawn's goons everywhere", says Zeb. "Every Imperial in the sector probably knows what we look like."

You step forward. The Spectres are important to the Rebellion. They can't afford to take the chance. But you can.

{-} The next active mission is “The Final Order”.

events.eventText:
With regret, you ask N-4M to inform Hera of the mission's failure. No one knows how much data Thrawn's infiltrators have collected; for their own safety, the agents throughout the entire sector should go into hiding.

You, too, decide to disappear from radar for now, while Thrawn searches for the insolent rebels who were so brazen as to invade his flagship. After a short time you are contacted by Hera. An opportunity presents itself to the Spectres.

{-} Each hero receives 1 XP.
{-} Heroes receive 100 credits per hero.

eventActions.tbText:
You hear the heated debate in the Ghost's common room well before you see it. "This could be our best chance to take the fight to Thrawn", insists Ezra, gesturing toward a holographic depiction of Lothal, complete with several Star Destroyers in orbit. "I know this might be a trap, but what if it isn't? We've been working hard to find an opening to strike back at Thrawn."

You interrupt to ask what's going on.

"An Imperial engineer got us a message", says Kanan. "He wants to defect, and he says he can get us into the datavault containing everything Thrawn's infiltrator droids have gathered." You have to simply imagine the significant look on Kanan's face as the mask tilts in your direction. "Information that gives him an edge on the Rebellion. But someone just letting us in? It sounds too good to be true."

"We'd never even get to the ground with Thrawn's goons everywhere", says Zeb. "Every Imperial in the sector probably knows what we look like."

You step forward. The Spectres are important to the Rebellion. They can't afford to take the chance. But you can.

{-} The next active mission is “The Final Order”.

{-} Each hero receives 1 XP.
{-} Heroes receive 100 credits per hero.
The security station explodes in a shower of sparks.

events.eventText: The security station explodes in a shower of sparks.

translatedEntityProperties.theText:
The security station that locks the doors is shielded by heavy plating.

{-} A figure can attack a security station (Health: 2 plus *1*; Defense: 1 {G}).

events.eventText: As the station explodes, alarms start blaring through the Chimaera.

Shortly after the last security station collapses, the heavy locks slide off the doors.

{-} The doors are now unlocked.

translatedEntityProperties.theText: The door leads to the infiltrator droid processing center.
The door leads to the infiltrator droid processing center.

eventActions.theText:
{-} The mission will progress when a door opens.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

events.eventText: Both doors slide open to reveal a control room filled with terminals, each processing valuable Rebel information collected by the infiltrator droids.

translatedEntityProperties.theText:
The door to the infiltrator droid processing center is locked tight.

{-} When all 3 security stations are destroyed, the doors unlock.

The door to the infiltrator droid processing center is locked tight.

{-} When all 3 security stations are destroyed, the doors unlock.

eventActions.tbText: The grand admiral turns from his work. “You're late. Disappointing.”

eventActions.customText:
{-} PATIENCE: This figure and the other highest figure cost Imperial figure within X spaces gains 1 {h} and 1 {g}. X is equal to the number of exhausted Rebel activation tokens.
{Q} Move 1 to attack {rebel}.
{A} Move 5 toward the closest terminal.
{A} Move 5 toward the closest terminal.
{-} ADMIRAL'S ORDERS: The other Imperial figure with the highest figure cost that can attack attacks {rebel}.
{-} STIM PACK: This figure recovers 2 {H}.

eventActions.tbText:
{-} <color="red">Thrawn</color> cannot be defeated. When Thrawn has suffered *1* or more {H}, he recovers all {H}, the heroes may push him up to 3 spaces, and he becomes <color="red">Stunned</color>.
{-} A Rebel figure can spend 2 movement points while adjacent to a terminal to which <color="red">Thrawn</color> is not also adjacent to try and destroy it ({J} or {I}). That figure may suffer 1 {C} during that test to reroll any number of dice.
{-} The Rebels win when all terminals are destroyed.

eventActions.theText:
{-} <color="red">Thrawn</color> cannot be defeated. When Thrawn has suffered *1* or more {H}, he recovers all {H}, the heroes may push him up to 3 spaces, and he becomes <color="red">Stunned</color>.
{-} A Rebel figure can spend 2 movement points while adjacent to a terminal to which <color="red">Thrawn</color> is not also adjacent to try and destroy it ({J} or {I}). That figure may suffer 1 {C} during that test to reroll any number of dice.
{-} The Rebels win when all terminals are destroyed.

eventActions.mainText:
You start to slice into the terminal's systems, trying to trigger an overload.

{-} Test {J} or {I}. Apply +1 {B} for each strain token on the terminal, then discard all strain tokens on the terminal. Enter the number of successes below.

inputList.theText: The security systems are just too complex. You need to keep trying.

events.eventText: The data spool stops as the overcharge blasts through the terminal.

translatedEntityProperties.theText:
Data is running over the terminal's display, collected by the infiltrator droids on the Rebel Alliance.

{-} A Rebel figure can spend 2 movement points while adjacent to a terminal to which <color="red">Thrawn</color> is not also adjacent to try and destroy it ({J} or {I}). That figure may suffer 1 {C} during that test to reroll any number of dice.

events.eventText: An injured trooper slinks away and wheezes into a comlink, “Rebels! Send backup!”
